channel.title: No Maemo / Meego?
channel.description:
Stumbling upon this forum I must say I'm slightly disappointed with not seeing any mention of the Nokia N900, even though it's still the greatest smart phone of them all.
"Discuss smart phones like your Android or Symbian here. Or discuss your Apple device."
It should be changed to include the N900 and upcoming N950! :D
After all... [img]http://wizzup.org/static/images/phonesimba2.png[/img]

item.title: No Maemo / Meego?
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

Mopman:

You said Android was slow because it runs Java. If you weren’t referring to Dalvik, how does that even make sense?

This is true. What I meant is that it is related to Java. Apart from that, I don’t know that much about Dalvik and Android; I blatantly assumed some of the performance penalties Java suffers from would still be there in Dalvik. Language design, etc…

Read full topic

item.title: No Maemo / Meego?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

You said Android was slow because it runs Java. If you weren’t referring to Dalvik, how does that even make sense?

Read full topic

item.title: No Maemo / Meego?
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:24, topic:390313”]WHY ARE YOU ALL IGNORING THE FACT ITS A DIFFERENT RUNTIME

It could be fucking GW-BASIC and it wouldn’t matter, why on earth does it matter what the source language is[/quote]

I don’t think we are saying that whatever applies to Java applies to Dalvik. My post about Java being slow was about Java, not Dalvik.

Speljohan, I’ve seen my share of ``Software Engineering’’ and their Enterprise crap. Just because a language is used often and fit for projects doomed to fail doesn’t mean that it’s a good language. Obviously my definition is extremely biased and based solely on personal experiences and internet resources, but I would really prefer not using those languages. Not professional? Buh, it really depends on what you call professional. If you mean 500 persons working on some big project and applying AGILE and XP crap being professional, then I’m sure you can call Java a professional language.

Read full topic

item.title: No Maemo / Meego?
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

pkedpker:

Lol is that cellphone running SCAR alternative? lol. Don’t tell me you will bot using your cellphone rofl can a cellphone even handle runescape? I thought cellphones got like 100 Mhz cpu’s

Yep, it runs. That’s the advantage of open source.
But it can’t handle runescape (yet?). I’ve tried it a few times, but the JRE segfaults eventually. Just before it gets to the login screen.

For the record, the N900 has a 600Mhz CPU. It can be overclocked but I don’t do that.

Read full topic

Nah. They’re up to 1.2Ghz Dual core CPUs now. Some are bragging about 2Ghz dual core CPUs, but no one has actually put any phone with such a CPU into production yet.

item.title: No Maemo / Meego?
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

Thug-life, you’re implying that all applications look like that. That’s not true, they’re all made for mobiles, it’s just that the N900 also has standard GTK and QT support, so running stuff like Simba on it is possible too. Obviously it’s not useful or viable, but it’s possible and that makes it awesome. Plus, it’s more than just a phone. Nokia itself calls it a ``Mobile Computer’’, which just happens to have calling support. For example, it can also transmit radio signals, all audio is then automatically routed over the radio transmitter. They use pulseaudio which makes this really easy. And you can make the pulseaudio from your laptop/desktop pipe all it’s audio to the N900 as well, thus transmitting that over the radio too. Pretty cool.

Nokia has not stopped working on MeeGo at all, they’re still going to use it on their high end devices. WP7 is horrible and I can see it go either way for Nokia. They’re still bringing out MeeGo phones this year.

Mopman, it doesn’t ``run’’ the language… FPC can just compile to ARM, just like GCC.

Mopar, that’s what confused me. I figured geeks would at least know about it. But then again, I recall it not being too popular in America. Perhaps you can’t even get it due to network provider nazi practices. It’s available in Canada & Europe, though.

Read full topic

item.title: No Maemo / Meego?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Looks like it would be terrible to use. You do remember it is phone, and attempting to run applications with the same desktop-like interface is where Microsoft and Windows Mobile (before 7) failed on, right?

I’m glad Nokia are moving onto Windows Phone 7 - it is a much better operating system than Symbian and Meego.

Read full topic
